website_summaries.verdict: Nikon's D3100 is an excellent entry-level digital SLR, and offers continuous autofocus during video recording for a true camcorder-like video-capture experience.
pros: Continuous autofocus during still and video shooting
Helpful Guide mode for new users
cons: Audible noise from lens when refocusing during video recording

customer_reviews.title: 7 years after purchase, still going strong.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the camera 7 years ago on Amazon. I just realized that I did not write a review at that time. You are probably not looking for this camera because it is "out-dated" as far as markets go but I am still using it and there has not been a single problem since I purchased it. I have used it in different countries as well. Okay, so this is not so much a product review but my appreciation of the Nikon brand. I would recommend a Nikon camera any day simply because mine has gone so many years without a single problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ali H

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: The camera is in good condition. I liked it. However, there is a material inside the lens which is making sound when the lenses are moved as if a part of the lenses is ripped.Plus the Lcd screen is obscured within seconds if not used and I need to start from scratch in case of adjusting settings. I haven't been able to figure out yet but it may be stemming from a former setup to maintain battery life longer.
customer_reviews.author: Yavuz Doner

customer_reviews.title: This camera is fantastic for our family
customer_reviews.text: This camera is fantastic for our family. We needed a more sophisticated camera to take family shots. In addition, our daughter is taking a high school photography class where she needs a DSLR camera. This camera take fantastic photos and is fairly easy to use. We say fairly easy because there are many different settings that can be used and we have had to read up on them, as anyone would for this type of camera. Delivery was on time in a sealed box. Seller was great. We would buy this camera again and from the same seller.
customer_reviews.author: VRF

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for all experience levels!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera for beginners or professionals. This is our first experience with DSLR, but this camera came highly recommended, and for good reason. Assembly is easy (PLEASE READ INSTRUCTIONS FIRST), and the digital interface is very easy to understand. Picture is crisp, with bright colors, and flash gives great lighting without bleaching or overpowering the subject. Multiple picture filetype storage (RAW and JPG) allows for flexible memory management and helps match the correct format to your system/editing software of choice. Would highly recommend this camera to anyone looking to take professional quality photos with minimal effort.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: love love LOVE my camera!!!
customer_reviews.text: the Nikon D3100 is PERFECT!! I am by no means a professional photographer, but with this camera, my pictures are AMAZING! It takes very little time to get used to the settings and if you know how to read, learning about aperature and focus aren't that difficult :) I love taking pictures and the D3100 is definately sharper than my point and shoot. My husband and I travel alot, so I can't wait until spring to start really shooting awesome pictures!! LOVE. IT. !!!! Things you may want to buy along with your new camera: -- to go with your 18-55mm lens -- to get a really GREAT zoom!!
customer_reviews.author: coastercrazy

customer_reviews.title: IMPRESSIVE NIKON
customer_reviews.text: I was always a Minolta fan. I really did not want to change, but I had people telling me to give the Nikon a try, I found alot of positive infomation on line so I gave it a try. I love my Nikon, I even purchased another lens. It is so easy to use, no complicated things to fool with. I am really not good at technical. My pictures are turning out so wonderful, I have had people requesting me to send them copies. The pictures are so clear and the movement does not blurr the picture if my hand shakes just a bit. I love it. Purchasing through Amazon was so very easy, I really like shopping with them.
customer_reviews.author: JAL

customer_reviews.title: but I really like this one
customer_reviews.text: I know nothing about DSLR cameras, and I have no prior experience with them, but I really like this one! It is easy to use for a beginner. It takes really nice pictures, the colors and everything are really clear. I haven't tested it much, I tend to keep it on "auto" but I am happy with the majority of the pictures I take. My only "complaint" is that sometimes it doesn't focus when/where I want - but if I learned how to do more with it, I feel like that would no longer be a problem. I am glad I invested in it!
customer_reviews.author: Katie G

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a sensible choice.
customer_reviews.text: After film cameras, darkrooms, point and shoots, a D40 and a D50, the 3100 DX seemed a sensible next step. Of course, I will add a few lenses and a bag and tripod now. Took it into the desert. Still trying to figure it all out. Mostly use it on the A settting and with a polarizing filter. Nikon or Cannon. Can't go wrong either way but stick with one. The soft ware is not much but free photo editing software abounds. Why does Nikon sell better versions of its editing software? For the serious, that is not the way to go. An easy to use, practical camera.
customer_reviews.author: Dean 1900

customer_reviews.title: Great starter camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great beginner camera for Nikon users and those starting out in vlogging, photography, or any other DSLR related activity. Would definitely recommend to anybody looking for a camera in this price range. The only negative point is that the LCD is as is, it does not flip out or around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: He's had it over a month and it works perfectly and is a great mid level camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my boyfriend as a surprise, as he loves to use mine. It came from an independent person selling an unused camera but through this common Nikon page, so I was worried at first. But it came in time, perfectly wrapped and in totally unopened packaging. I swear, it was never even touched. He's had it over a month and it works perfectly and is a great mid level camera. No issues with the lens or focus or battery life. And for the price, it's completely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Senjou

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Camera came looking brand new. Delivered on time and even included a memory card. Came with all necessary parts except a usb connection for the camera. However I don’t remember if the seller said it would come with one of those. Over all it’s a great purchase and very affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Ann-Marie C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter
customer_reviews.text: I got my start on this camera, and I'm glad I did. This is a perfect basic camera to learn on, but still shoots great pictures. This is an older model now, but if this is all you can afford, don't be afraid to go for it. However, if you're buying this camera knowing you're going to be fully dedicated to improving your photography, I would wait and splurge a little bit more. I upgraded from the D3100 to the D5300 not too long after buying this one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dehne

customer_reviews.title: daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know much about cameras, this one was a Christmas gift for my daughter and she loves it. She's 16 and she's able to work all the different functions, and it does a LOT. I was told this would be a great starter camera for someone interested in professional photography and they were right. The pictures she takes are awesome. This thing really zooms in too. I was amazed at the things she showed me. I am very happy she is happy and I would recommend this camera for anyone interested in this type of camera from the novice to the more experienced.
customer_reviews.author: KingsNano

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE this camera
customer_reviews.text: Our family is very active. We play hockey, we run, we play soccer, we take vacations. This camera takes THE best photos. Whether it's an indoor hockey game or goofing around outside my photos are clear and sharp and gorgeous. It takes a day or so to get used to all the adjustments but I would highly recommend this one! For even better fast pictures (hockey, soccer, baseball, etc) there is another option for VR lenses. The VR lenses are even better than the ones here. Both are great thought and I love this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Still my partner after 7 years
customer_reviews.text: After 7 years this camera is still my partner for all of my photography work it really is a simple camera and makes picture taking a snap once you get the hang of the settings. I love the camera but in the near future I would love to upgrade to another Nikon camera as my skills rise to new levels
customer_reviews.author: Ryan J Adams

customer_reviews.title: Serious upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of my lame point and shoot camera and I did not want to go into hock for a top-of-the-line model. This model fit me to a tee. It was reasonably priced and takes fantastic shots. It can even do 1080p movies. I don't really need this since I have a digital video camera. But, it is a handy feature to have around. Nikon's rep is well-known so I don't have to bore you with the details. Needles to say, I am very pleased with my DSLR and I would highly recommend this model for people on a budget, but want a DSLR with better-than-average features.
customer_reviews.author: Duane G. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for years and use it for basic photography. It takes good photos and is well worth it. Depending on what you want to do, you will eventually need a tripod and to try out different lenses and photo editing software to get the most out of this camera. I've made my money back from the art I've made from this camera and I've gotten some great family photos and nature photos as well!
customer_reviews.author: twoheadedtiger

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Though I'm not an particularly sophisticated camera user, I found the features easy to use, and consistently took better quality pictures, getting the focus, exposure, and results I desired more often than with smaller non-slr digital cameras. I particularly like the smoothness (no travel) of the shutter button, because I was easily able to take pictures at 1/15 second exposure with exceptional clarity. This bundle appears to be a very good value, but the combination is somewhat heavy to carry compared with compact digital cameras.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Very good, very useful
customer_reviews.text: Mine included a 300mm lens. I use it for bird (and some scenic) photography and it has been very good. Have taken it to Chesapeake Bay salt marshes, Merritt Island and Canaveral seashore, Mississippi River migration hotspots, the Gulf Coast, Lake Huron, Whitefish Bay, the Lake Erie freshwater marshes and the Appalachians and it has been all I would ask for - almost. The one downer is that it doesn't have the advanced focusing system (a la Canon D5 and D7) which makes photography birds in flight a LOT easier and more productive.

customer_reviews.title: My 1st DSLR
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st DSLR and I couldn't be more pleased. I've already bought a better glass for it and the pictures are amazing. The 18-55mm lens it came with was just too restrictive for the photos I wanted so I bought the 18-105mm lens and the pictures are truly amazing. The menu did take me awhile to get used to but the buttons are well within reach for quick adjustments to the most common settings (aperture, iso, shutter speed). Photography is just a hobby for me. I know there are better cameras out there and I have a ways to go but its real fun with this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Eshcole

customer_reviews.title: First real camera
customer_reviews.text: I got this one for a friend in one of my US trips. I tested for some days to make sure that everything was working. I don't know much about photography but I was impressed that only by using the automatic function and changing lenses I was still able to get really nice pictures. Great image quality. The one I got is second hand but it came with a nice case. I don't do photography for a living, so I wouldn't even think go get one for myself, it is too much volume, but my friend is really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ce Gzz

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera for just starting out in photography
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to take more/better pictures of all of the events we wanted to capture. This has been doing a great job. We brought it to Italy for pictures on the honeymoon and came back with some fantastic shots that turned into a photobook for family and friends to read. The supplied lens provides good versatility for all kinds of shots. The settings are pretty straight forward and most of the time we leave it on auto and it comes out looking great. Much improved over the typical smart phone photos that we took before this came along.
customer_reviews.author: Gem Box

customer_reviews.title: A truely great DSLR
customer_reviews.text: After owning the Nikon D3100 for a little over 2 weeks I've fallen in love with it. I previously had a Nikon D60 DSLR which I recently sold to a friend and decided to upgrade to the 3100. It was, in my opinion, a really good upgrade from the D60. Besides having a much higher resolution, some of the new features on the 3100 make it much more usable for the types of photography I normally do. I also like the HD movie feature with the 3100. When using a HDMI cable to view movies on my HDTV it really shows the quality of the 3100. I highly recommend this product to those who enjoy higher end digital photography.
customer_reviews.author: Seawind

customer_reviews.title: Good product, bud shipping.  Received Incomplete
customer_reviews.text: Nikon It's really an excellent product. I bought for a gift for my father, he have a Pentax analogic. He was so fascinated. Unfortunately, the camera arrived incomplete without one of the lenses. And there has not been able to test other virtues. Buy the product based on the comments and rancking. And I have been assured by my father, who still does not finish yet reading the entire manual. I regret not correct processes have higher shipments in the warehouse. Not the first time I had a bad dispatch.
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: So happy.
customer_reviews.text: I was browsing for a camera for a long time before finally deciding to buy a Nikon D3100. I am a college freshman and just about to start a photography course in August. From what I had heard, this camera was a great choice for someone just wanting to get their start in photography. I'm so glad I made the choice to buy it! It's an awesome camera, great for just tracking events and I know it'll be great when I start taking classes. It arrived really quickly, which was awesome because it meant that I had it in time to take it on a missions trip to the Dominican Republic! I definitely reccomend it.
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Perfect entry-level DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! It's my first DSLR, and it's all I was hoping for. The kit lens is a great intro lens, the camera is easy to use and Nikon's screen graphics are helpful and intuitive. It also includes lots of easy to use features with many smart modes, but also has all the manual modes that can be delved into once you get more serious with it. The quality is great, and I'll be using this camera for several years providing that Nikon has a great selection of lens that I can use on this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin O'Gara

customer_reviews.title: Great DSLR
customer_reviews.text: After taking a photography class with my very average digital camera, I decided to ask for this for Christmas. This is a GREAT camera, and very easy to use. I read a few reviews that talk about how confusing the controls are...it is an SLR, which means it isn't some point and shoot camera. The manual is very easy to understand, and I amd suprised how easy it was to learn how to use the camera. There a lot of shooting options on this, and the quality is great. This is just as good as any of the more expensive Nikon cameras. I am very pleased, and will be buying from Nikon from now on,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled to have this as my first DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. It's a great way to step into the DSLR world. I recommend getting a book such as Nikon D3100: From Snapshots to Great Shots if this is your first DSLR, otherwise the learning curve from point and shoot to this camera can be very daunting. It is sturdy and the battery life has been as good as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Greta Lopossa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for a novice like me!
customer_reviews.text: I researched extensively before selecting a digital SLR camera to begin learning more about taking full control of a camera's hardware. While everything I read said that the most important part of a photographer's life would be the glass, and the body of the camera was only a secondary consideration...obviously the body of the camera will have some relation to the lenses available for use! The reviews here are excellent and in-depth, and as I say, I'm just a novice, so I have nothing to add save to say that these reviews didn't steer me wrong, and I've been *very* happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: sophistre

customer_reviews.title: Love my first DSLR!
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend this Nikon 3100 entry level DSLR. Like most people, the choice for me was also between a Canon and Nikon. While they are both excellent cameras, I liked the look of the Nikon more. I haven't purchased any additional lens yet but the kit lens has taken some gorgeous pictures. The menu is easy navigate and it is also easy to transfer pictures to my computer. I also purchased the Dummies Book for the 3100 which has really helped me know more about DSLR photography and this camera. Love it and highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: mac01

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: This item has been on the market for a while and is still going strong. That alone should tell you something if you're considering buying one. I bought this for my wife on her birthday (2 birthday's ago actually). She loves it, it takes great photos and still operates like brand new. If you need a more extensive review, there are plenty of them out there. Great SLR product, great SLR price.
customer_reviews.author: David Jag

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D3100 14.2MP Digital SLR Camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, arrived ahead of schedule, and in new condition as advertised by seller, packaged very well, double boxed. The features and quality are outstanding for the price, more than I expected. This is my second Nikon coming from 35mm and very happy with this product. The ability to produce HD quality video is remarkable. I would recommend this camera at any level, especially for an entry level photographer. This camera has great add-on ability with flexibility beyond the imagination. Overall very satisfied and experience no problems.
customer_reviews.author: D. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D3100 - AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I was very nervous buying a "used" camera. Not knowing if scratches were on it, dirty, focus issues or smells like someone's cigarettes. etc... But this was a First Class Purchase all the way. PROS: The price was unbeatable! Order was placed and processed without a problem. Purchased 2nd day delivery. Order was shipped next business day. Camera arrived as promised. Not knowing what to expect when the camera arrived. we unwrapped it and I swear I thought this was a NEW camera. It was in Nikon packaging with all the bells and whistles like it came from the factory. Camera tested; all works perfectly- even smells new! LOL CONS: NONE! No worries. This customer is coming back!
customer_reviews.author: Alternate-Route

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera.
customer_reviews.text: I have only had the camera for few months now but it works great. Takes pictures quickly. The quality is good. And provides much better depth of field with the standard lens then I thought. We took it on vacation with us and came back with better pictures than we have ever had. I'm just a beginner to the DSLRs. This camera appears to have all of the features that I need to begin taking better pictures and to learn how to use some of the more advanced features. I'm glad I didn't spend more money on a camera with features that I probably wouldn't appreciate, at least not at my current level of expertise.
customer_reviews.author: clicster

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing camera! You get a lot more camera than what you should expect for the money. I've always loved the D40, D40x, D60, and now the D3100. This is a very small, compact body, which is exactly what I need because I take it everywhere. Controls are will laid out, options are plentiful, and the in-camera editing has some very useful little features. If you're disappointed with this camera there is something wrong with you.
customer_reviews.author: aztriman

customer_reviews.title: great beginner DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I love my Nikon d3100. I had a Nikon cool pix before and have always wanted a DSLR for the crisper pics. This is a great beginner DSLR camera and I am still figuring out how to use the settings. My mom also has a Nikon so her lenses fit with this camera which I am SO excited about. I am going on vacation in a few weeks so I can truly test what the camera can do! So far I have taken pics of my god son and my friend loves them. This is a great camera! Love it
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Short review
customer_reviews.text: Not much more can be said about this camera - it does what it intends pretty well. Just be advised about formatting the memory card before you take pictures. The camera can do that, just get to the menu for it. Otherwise, this camera has been great. We're finally not missing those pivotal moments with this camera - those smaller cameras typically take 2-4 seconds to decide if they're going to take a pic or not. And it does tack pretty good movie quality scenes as well.
customer_reviews.author: Conan

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this camera. This is the first serious caera Ive ever purchased and it has lived up to expectations. Parts are all quality and the diversity of features is very impressive. Ive already had some stunningly beatiful pictures taken. Would definitely recommend. Be aware though not to purchase the Transcend SD card with it as part of the Amazon bundle. It is not on the approved memory card list in the manual and the card died twice on me before I finally went for the refund and got the Sandisk.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Light, but no lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a Nikon D90 as a gift for my son and had time to play with it extensively prior to the gifting. The subsequent purchase of the D3100, for my needs, had all of the advantages and none of the disadvantages of the D90: It is amazingly light in weight, smaller, far more intuitive, has greater mega-pixels,and satisfactory video capability. The only down-side is that it doesn't come in a kit with the Nikkor 18-105mm--a lens which allows great portraiture with just a twist of the wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Pietro d'Palermo

customer_reviews.title: Bought one for me and then one for my daughter
customer_reviews.text: Takes great pictures -- you appear almost professional. Easy user interface. I liked mine so much that when my daughter became interested in photography it was the perfect Christmas present for her. Prior to my Nikon I had a Canon Digital SLR which also took amazing pictures but I find the user interface of the Nikon to be a little more user friendly ... note that my Canon was a 2005 purchase so it's quite possible (and likely) their UI has significantly improved since then.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Love my D3100
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my Nikon D3100. I purchased it as an upgrade from a previous Nikon point and shoot camera. I'm an amateur photographer so I can't speak from an experienced point of view but I think this camera is great for beginner photographers. The controls are pretty ease to use. The camera is small and light but sturdy. I was considering getting the Canon Rebel before buying this camera but after trying the Canon at a local photography shop, I felt the Nikon was better and I was right. Very please. Great product for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for someone new to DSLR cameras
customer_reviews.text: My wife has a Canon DSLR that she bought a couple of years ago. I have used it few times, but not often. I wanted my own camera and did a lot of research before buying this one. So far I have loved this camera and even my wife has been impressed with a number of the features that it has. I still have a long ways to go in terms of learning how to use all of the features on this camera, but I like the photos that I have taken with it.
customer_reviews.author: Hooligan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first DSLR camera and so far its awesome. It is so easy to use and the image quality is amazing. I have little knowledge of photography, so I was skeptical to move away from the point and shoot cameras since the quality wasnt bad and it was simple to use. However, this camera has made the transition easy. I am learning all of the settings and such but so far this camera is awesome! Id totally recommend this to someone who is ready to make the move from point and shoot to DSLR. Hope this helps anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: love, love
customer_reviews.text: love,love,love!!! I purchased this camera in 2010 and this is working perfectly fine till date. I purchased few lenses. And they work great with it. price has been dropped and that a great deal at less price. If you are new to DSLR and want to buy one. This is great for beginners. I will probably move to another upgrade version at some point but rt now this is it. Pair it with tripod and few gud lenses.
customer_reviews.author: sban

customer_reviews.title: Using this for video? Beware the jello cam!
customer_reviews.text: As a bargain video shooter the D3100 sounded ideal: 24p, interchangeable lens, great image quality, manual features. But there's one problem: beware the jello cam! Jello cam--also known as rolling shutter--is when a video image wobbles and bends like jello when the camera is moved. To a certain extent it's a problem with all CMOS cameras, but this Nikon seems to be particularly jello-y. Locked-down footage looks great. Stills look great. But if handheld run-and-gun style shooting is your thing think twice!
customer_reviews.author: ★ School Living Club

customer_reviews.title: Really nice camera!
customer_reviews.text: I was upgrading from a point and shoot, and wanted to move to the DSLR range. Based on my research, I felt this was a good option for a beginner. I have gotten some really good photos, but the only thing is to get used to manually moving the focus. Also, using the various preset modes was very useful as I could get the sort of shots I was looking for, without really doing much manual changes. I highly recommend this as a good cost effective option for people who are starting out with a DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: Anand Vijayakumar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to take great photos
customer_reviews.text: I have been pining for a digital SLR for a couple years. A vacation trip to Lake Tahoe and Reno finally provided the impetus to go from want to buy. Several friends have Nikon DSLRs and all raved about them, so the choice was pretty easy. I love this camera: it's easy to use, the exposure in high or low light situations is excellent, the colors are vibrant,and battery life is very good. I have no regrets about choosing the Nikon D3100 and am looking forward to a long, fun, and fulfilling relationship.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Lerude

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures. Some of my friends have the 5100 ...
customer_reviews.text: Great pictures. Some of my friends have the 5100 or the 3300 and my pictures are sometimes better than theirs. Don't let the old model fool ya. It still keeps it's quality up after several years! I use it to photograph my architecture projects and to record some music covers and it does what I need so I really love it!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Gama

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner camera.
customer_reviews.text: Well to start off, I'm 17 years old and this is my first DSLR camera. It's freaking amazing. I've had it for about a week now and I have no regrets whatsoever. The picture quality is amazing, it feels great in my hands, and I got it for $550 (Normally $650). I've been using it to take pictures and film my friends skating. The only issue with my camera is that there's just one dead pixel, this isn't Amazon's fault, though, so I didn't knock off any stars.
customer_reviews.author: Chris V.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera in order to take better photos for my food blog, and HD videos for my media production class. It's honestly really difficult to take a bad photo with this camera! It's easy to use, has many great features, and is lightweight. It has a solid grip area and a sturdy feel. Just be careful with the strap, since mine came undone and the camera fell to the ground (luckily only a few inches, and it's fine). It takes good quality videos too. The only problem is that zooming isn't very smooth, and sometimes the sound of it gets picked up on the mic. Other than that, it's a fantastic camera for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Nikon D80 which is a great camera. However, I wanted something lighter to take with me on trips. I have several point and shoots from Canon and Nikon and just prefer to use a DSLR. It's a great little camera at a fraction of the price I paid for the D80 when it came out. It's light enough to carry around and it's great to be able to switch out lenses with my other Nikon. I like the video capability on this for short clips. Overall I think it's a great buy! I even love the 18-55mm VR lens that comes with it.
customer_reviews.author: RCH

customer_reviews.title: Good, light camera with basic functions.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for use in a light aircraft (Cessna) - the low camera weight and low cost were ideal for our purposes. We are attaching the cameras to the windows to look out perpendicularly using a suction mound () and with a 35mm lens (). The picture quality is excellent, especially at high ISO - even 1600 ISO gives good image quality, though noise is noticable. The only things I miss are some of the advanced functions (e.g. multiple exposure time lapse).
customer_reviews.author: Simbamangu

customer_reviews.title: mamiya are also very good brands. Now the Nikon I buy is for ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a retired photographer. I always wanted to have a NIKON camera. Because I work with pentax cameras, mamiya are also very good brands. Now the Nikon I buy is for family events and it's enough for me and my photographic expositions.
customer_reviews.author: Galo

customer_reviews.title: My first SLR
customer_reviews.text: This is my first SLR, and I love it. I choose it over the Canon, and I'm happy. I bought a 1.8 50mm lens for it (and love that). I couldn't ask for more from this camera. The only things I don't like are the strap that comes with it and the fact it doesn't come with a clear UV filter to protect the lens. Battery life is great and the pictures are amazing. I contemplated buying an SLR for a long time before finally taking the plunge. I only wish I had done it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this camera as a good starter DSLR for expecting father
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes better pictures then I have ever seen from any standard digital camera or phone camera. It's better then a simple point and shoot, handles low light and movement much better then other cameras. The level of detail on close ups is amazing. I would recommend it for a starting amateur photographer to get them started with DSLR's or someone who wants a little closer to professional level pictures but is new to higher end cameras.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: NO LENS!!
customer_reviews.text: When getting the package I received the camera, battery, and strap NOT the lense. When talking to customer service they can not do anything which is super frustrating.....all they could do is return the product and hope the new package has the lens in it.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: This camera is everything I hoped it would be and more. It's perfect for an amateur like me; the operation is straight forward and easy to figure out, the auto mode makes taking everyday pictures a breeze and I really like the guide option that helps you pick the mode you need for the look you're going for in a photo. My dad went to school for photography so he helped me pick this one and now he's really jealous of it. I would recommend this camera to novices and professionals alike.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Great used camera, no issues yet
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it to take pictures, but the photos are coming out great and the camera is easy to use after reading the manual online. Was shipped extremely quickly compared to the estimated dates. Pretty good camera for those wanting to get into photography, but dont want to spend too much money.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Bynum

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the DSLR Beginner
customer_reviews.text: My fiancee and I bought this to take pictures of our wedding planning process and also as an investment into our future. Before this camera, both of us were only accustomed to the simple point and shoot digital cameras. While we are still just beginning to learn to handle this piece of machinery, the results that we are getting are already clearly different from a non-DSLR camera. I can't wait until I see what it's truly capable of once I know what I'm doing!
customer_reviews.author: momomo58

customer_reviews.title: A perfect camera for this beginner
customer_reviews.text: I have been in the market for a good beginner camera for quite some time. I didn't want to spend a lot of money, but I wanted to get a good quality camera on which to learn. After 3+ months, the 3100 has been the perfect choice for me. Though there are newer models available with lots of extra features, I find the 3100 to be all that I need it to be. It takes great photos, works with all of my technology, and gives me the tools I need to learn about taking photographs. Will I upgrade at some point? Certainly. But, for now, I'm very happy with the 3100 and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: Superb Camera, Regardless of Price
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to keep this review short as there are more than enough incredibly detailed reviews. This camera is absolutely amazing. It's been absolutely perfect for me in every situation I've used it in, including my cousin's wedding, multiple hiking and backpacking trips, plant and animal photography (with the 55-300mm lens), etc. A huge plus for me is the weight of the camera; keeping weight down while backpacking is very important, and this camera is very light for its size. [This is also a great camera for underwater / scuba photography with the right housing].
customer_reviews.author: J. West

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for begginers
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! This is excellent for somebody who doesn't have tons of money for expensive photography equipment, but still wants quality pictures. The quality is great, it's easy to work, and understand, and it's reasonably priced. I bought a 55-200 mm lens for it, however, because the zoom was not adequate enough for me. Overall, though, great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D3100
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Camera after alot of review. There was two reasons I bought this one was price the second was package. it was a good price and packaged with both lens made a good deal for my picture taking. I have a Nikon 35mm with 3 lens and all kind of accessories. which is obsolete now but still a number one camera. Nikon is a good name in cameras. This is not the top end in cameras but does the trick for me easy to use controls in the right place and if you try to keep up with top end you will be buying every week. Amazon had the best price and quick ship
customer_reviews.author: G lock guy

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, manual explains things well and was up & going in no time. I use 55-200mm lens most of the time. I use for grand children playing football, baseball and soccer and camera has lots of features for me to capture those moments.
customer_reviews.author: Captn' Bob

customer_reviews.title: Really loved my camera....
customer_reviews.text: Apesar de ter ficado um pouco triste pois a Nikon logo depois lançou a D3200 com recurso wi-fi, continuo a desfrutar minha camera que já se pagou pelos trabalhos fotograficos que já fiz com ela. Amazing camera, despite feel sick with Nikon because, few months later released the model D3200 with wi-fi option. Anyways, I loved my camera. I taked pics in my trip to Brasil and now living in Costa Rica working and some photos, my camera is already payed.
customer_reviews.author: Beto

customer_reviews.title: It has taken some amazing pictures and has helped me capture memories of my ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this camera for two years with no issues. It has been on many trips and more drops than I care to admit but has never broken or had any issues. It has taken some amazing pictures and has helped me capture memories of my son growing up.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Lagos

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love it, it looks brand new plus I saved a couple bucks, delivery was just right on time. I spent about two weeks learning about this camera so I was able to unravel and get everything set in a few minutes. I love it and quality of the camera is perfect for me. I do photography as a hobby not as a profession so I don't need the much more professional and expensive cameras, yeah!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners and pros
customer_reviews.text: Perfect first DSLR camera for us. Auto settings are perfect while learning. Manual settings easy to understand once you understand DSLR cameras. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Kara Kelso

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: With the right lens, this camera gives better quality results than most entry level DSLR's. A must have. Definitely invest in a 24-70mm lens if you can, and you'll see what I mean! Great video quality, not so much audio. Definitely needs a bit more of a built in stabilizer, along with an external mic. I wouldn't suggest this for solely video, but definitely something to get you by!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria Cholewinski

customer_reviews.title: Superb Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my first DSLR camera and I love using it everytime I get a chance. The picture quality is fantastic. I did it right by buying an additional lens the 55-200 lens. This way you have the mix of up close everyday photos with the lens that comes with it and far away shots that get you up close. I have to say I took over 200 photos on a single day on a charged battery and the battery level stayed to full charge the entire time. It was a mixture of day and night shots as well. Love the camera and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ken M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wife has been using this camera for years and still loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Edward A. Del Castillo

customer_reviews.title: superb
customer_reviews.text: Went from an Olympus Evolt 500 to this camera. Its lighter and takes better pictures, especially in low light conditions. the evolt was decent in bright light but failed miserably in low light/indoors. The focus motor constantly trying to focus and the focus assist light constantly flashing. Extremely annoying. I could not be happier with this purchase. Picked up an extra lens with discount for the cam/lens combo deal. Thanks amazon I love you! LOL
customer_reviews.author: KAKKNAR STORMHAMMER

customer_reviews.title: Bought mine refurbished
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these refurbished and I couldn't be happier. Don't be afraid to buy refurbished electronics, people! I got a great deal! Everything works on my d3100 as intended, no problems, clean sensor- everything is excellent. This is a great camera for DSLR beginners/college students. Or someone who just wants something nice and light, and small; this camera is nice for people with smaller hands. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: I am satisfied with the purchase and with the quality of the ...
customer_reviews.text: The product meets the specifications indicated in the Amazon portal. I am satisfied with the purchase and with the quality of the product purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: LENSES
customer_reviews.text: One reason I bought this camera, was due to the fact that it will accept all of the lenses that I used on my old Nikon FM-2. They will work just fine in "manual" mode. This is a definite plus, as most of the old lenese, are worth more than the camera is. The Autofocus Lens that came with the D3100, is good for general purpose use, and performs quite adequately.
customer_reviews.author: John Wilbur Williams

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Iconic
customer_reviews.text: Nikon iconic name right price for entry level camera. Lots of features good bang for the buck. With smart phones getting camera upgrades almost monthly the SLR may seem dated to many not so fast SLR is more then just photo quality its the fit of the camera in ones hands. The lens options to choose from and so much more.
customer_reviews.author: I Just Shop Here

customer_reviews.title: i so much love this camera, i recomend it
customer_reviews.text: reading the bad reviews on this camera made me be spectacle about buying it, however after reviewing other cameras bad reviews and noticing that a lot of them are similar if not the same, i decided to pay attention to the good reviews and i did not regret getting this camera if your a beginner this camera is more than enough. you wont regret it....
customer_reviews.author: axel

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Came quickly, packaged well with every component individually wrapped, including booklet and instructional cd/dvd. Camera works fine and set up is intuitive, not difficult at all. Yet to use it, but looking forward to it! Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Momof8

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera for a SLR beginner
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ever SLR camera. I've always just had point and shoots. This one is an easy transition. It offers the removable lens and quality photos while it isn't as advanced as many other SLR cameras. I felt comfortable right away in using it. I'm still figuring out some of the features, but I am already impressed and pleased with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L. Koenning

customer_reviews.title: Love this Camera!
customer_reviews.text: My first SLR camera that is not a 'point & shoot'. This camera takes stunning photos when set on auto, I've taken 2000+ pictures at my kids sporting events in the last 5 weeks. I haven't had time to sit down and figure out all the bells and whistles(read manual settings) yet, but when I do, I'm sure it will warrant 5+ stars, I did a lot of shopping around looking for the best value for my money, and I do believe I found it here,
customer_reviews.author: LN5

customer_reviews.title: impressive!
customer_reviews.text: I use this camera for stop motion animation and with good lighting this camera is perfect for the job
customer_reviews.author: JOSh

customer_reviews.title: Defected?
customer_reviews.text: I like this camera, but I'm not sure if I got a defected one. It takes so long to focus and has the worst time focusing. And sometimes when it is focused and you take the picture it comes out blurry.
customer_reviews.author: Madbil

customer_reviews.title: but I got it in good shape used and it works great for amatuer photography
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I would pay the full price for it, but I got it in good shape used and it works great for amatuer photography. I would highly recommend reading the entire manual even if you don't normally, as it can be confusing to use if you're not used to manual settings.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Way better than a Point and Shoot!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first DSLR and I am very impressed. Feels right in the hands. It's compact, but lacks some more professional features of the more expensive ones. But you don't need a 2 or 3 thousand dollar Nikon or Canon to produce quality pictures. This camera is proof of that. Comes with good basic photo software too. If you want a starting DSLR quality camera that fulfills most, if not all, of your photography needs, then look no further. Way better than a point and shoot!
customer_reviews.author: Steven G.

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife's birthday. Excellent entry level camera. Good pictures, decent number of options for entry level photography enthusiasts. The included lenses are ok, a better lens would really boost the performance. Take the savings you get on the camera and buy a better lens. You will be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Dubblenikle

customer_reviews.title: Again I received a good product but not the lenses I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product, like new however I noticed that the Dk -20 rubber eyecup was repaired ( ha! I found were it was repaired Nikon! you should be careful and leave no trace if the description is restored to "like new condition") Only 4 stars because I ordered the camera and the 18-55mm VR lenses, but I got the Non VR ED II instead. I will contact the seller and update this review.
customer_reviews.author: amose

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my camera. I've taken so many amazing pictures with it, and I haven't even had the chance to use my bigger lens. I can't wait! I will definitely be a forever Nikon user! This was a great price too, for the package. Don't hesitate if you're thinking of purchasing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it so much
customer_reviews.text: Look no further! This camera takes amazing pictures, here is one I snapped just messing around with it! Easy to use! Very professional!
customer_reviews.author: Annon

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this camera thus far.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived promptly, I have found no dislikes thus far, I am learning the functioning of the camera and really like the Help button. I need all the help I can get when it comes to really knowing how to take good pictures. The camera takes very nice pictures. and I am sure when I get some Photography classes that it will even take better pictures.I am looking forward, to be able to use More of the features beside just the point and shoot, and picking up more of the lenses for it. The camera is lightweight and I am completely satisfied with this produce
customer_reviews.author: Arlie

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding entry level DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I'm very much an amateur photographer, and this is a great camera for a motivated amateur to bump up from point-and-shoots. It already takes amazing pictures out of the box with the 18-55mm lens it comes with and on automatic settings. But there are tons of options and settings for elevating your photography. I've had this camera for nearly a year, and I'm still learning how to use it, and loving every minute of it.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this camera. It is everything I was looking for. I like to use the manual settings, except when photographing kids--simply because the kids are always moving FAST. I like the quick response when the auto settings are on, since I have been able to capture lots of cute moments that pass in a blink!
customer_reviews.author: A. Stevick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera
customer_reviews.text: I havent totally figured out everything about this camera but so far i am very pleased. This is a great beginner camera. The lens it comes with is ok but i do recommend getting another lens for it so you can expand your options when photographing things. The HD movies i have made so far are great quality, videos are clear with no fuzzy ness unless you move quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Best Value for DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Excellent entry level DSLR camera. Love all the features and performs like a true star. The included lens takes amazing and beautiful pics. Having an aperture of 3.5 - 5.6, I was amazed how well it does with indoor light (at night) with no flash. I highly recommend camera. Best part with DSLR..we have so many lenses to choose from for our D3100 to take great pics with ;)
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing first DSLR for Mother's Day
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera for my mom on mother's day, and she absolutely loves it! The camera provides excellent pictures and comes with a decent lens. Pros: -Very cost efficient DSLR capable of taking 1080p video with a 14MP sensor. -Great low light capabilities. -Stunning pictures and videos. -Comes with very strong flash, able to put external flash. -Accurate Autofocus with 11 points. Cons: -Autofocus during video makes a very loud noise and it shows up on video. Since you aren't able to plug in an external Mic, this takes off a star. -No simple way to adjust ISO and Aperture on the fly. Interface is a bit complicated for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Nikon review
customer_reviews.text: My pyrchase of the Nikon camera went fine without any delays in delivery or damage when unpacking the camera. The Nikon 3100d with multiple lenses is a great entry level camera. After purchasing the camera I took it on vacation and took over 300 pictures without any complications. I would also recommend using the Nikon software to edit your pics prior to printing.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, amazing quality
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great. I got it as an upgrade for my point-and-shoot Canon in mid December and I am pretty happy with it so far. It starts immediately and it is extremely light which was important to me. It fits in a purse! (but make sure you put it in a camera bag first) I ordered it with the free supersaver shipping and it arrived in 3 days via UPS, so that was pretty nice. Overall, high quality pictures and easy to operate. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: FreeSpirit

customer_reviews.title: Love it--what a good buy
customer_reviews.text: Love it--what a good buy. Haven't learned to use the manual settings yet, but someday... It has saved me from spending so much more on professional portraits and the quality is great. Even if I don't get the shot exactly the way I want it, I have lots to work with in photo-editing programs. I've had it a full year, and it's a best buy for someone who doesn't splurge often...
customer_reviews.author: California 1254

customer_reviews.title: great little camera
customer_reviews.text: for someone interested in more than a point,and shoot camera,the d3100 will satisfy.i would strongly advise to forget the 18-55mm lens that comes with the camera,and purchase a good quality prime lens.the prime will make an amazing difference,and the results would please most any photographer.
customer_reviews.author: J. COLLETTE

customer_reviews.title: Amazing beginner camera.
customer_reviews.text: This is my very first DSLR, and I'm in love with it. The photo quality is great, the menus are easily navigable, and it's just such an intuitive machine. Excellent build quality, shipped insanely quick. Absolutely no hiccups whatsoever. The only concern I have is that on the quick start paper, it says there is a lens hood included with the 18-55mm lens. I didn't see one in there.
customer_reviews.author: Jared M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for an entry level DSLR - Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera for an enthusiast who is ready to go to the next level. The quality of this camera and the pictures it takes is magnificent. I thoroughly recommend this to anyone who is looking for a great DSLR at a very good price. The really nice thing is that there are 2 really good lenses included - everything you need to get started.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Sulin

product_meta.title: Nikon D3100 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 Auto Focus-S Nikkor Zoom Lens (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Style:18-55mm VR Lens| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingNikon's affordable, compact and lightweight D3100 digital SLR features a high-resolution 14-megapixel CMOS DX sensor, high-quality 3x NIKKOR 18-55mm VR image stabilization zoom lens and intuitive onboard assistance including the learn-as-you grow Guide Mode.Capture beautiful pictures and amazing Full HD 1080p movies with sound and full-time autofocus. Easily capture the action other cameras miss with a fast start up time, split-second shutter release, 3 frames per second shooting and 11-point autofocus.Lens: 5-Year Warranty (1-Year International + 4-Year USA Extension).

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


 Nikon's affordable, compact and lightweight D3100 digital SLR features a high-resolution 14-megapixel CMOS DX sensor, high-quality 3x NIKKOR 18-55mm VR image stabilization zoom lens and intuitive onboard assistance including the learn-as-you grow Guide Mode. 

Capture beautiful pictures and amazing Full HD 1080p movies with sound and full-time autofocus. 

Easily capture the action other cameras miss with a fast start up time, split-second shutter release, 3 frames per second shooting and 11-point autofocus. 



Capture 3 frames per second for fast action shooting. 
Capture pictures and make movies in near darkness with an ISO range of 100 to 3200 (expandable to 12800-Hi2). EXPEED 2, Nikon's new image processing engine, assures breathtakingly rich image quality, managing color, contrast, exposure and noise. 

One-touch Live View and movie recording lets you see the action on the 3-inch monitor and the Scene Recognition System automatically chooses the ideal settings. 

You can also select from 6 Automatic Exposure Scene Modes: Portrait, Landscape, Child, Sports, Close-up or Night Portrait for stunning results in otherwise challenging conditions. 

Active D-Lighting restores picture-enhancing detail in shadows and highlights. 

A built-in pop-up flash is ready for those times when there just isn't enough light and in-camera image editing allows creative freedom and effects, without the need for a computer. 

Nikon D3100 Highlights 

Easy-to-use Guide Mode walks you through the settings you need for the shot you want. 14.2-megapixel DX-format CMOS Image Sensor
Delivers beautiful photographs and prints well beyond 20 x 30 inches. 

Includes 3x 18-55mm Zoom-NIKKOR VR Image Stabilization Lens
Included lens offers the legendary NIKKOR optical quality and fast, accurate autofocus for vivid color, striking contrast and crisp detail and VR image stabilization to ensure the sharpest hand-held pictures and movies. 

Full 1080p HD Cinematic Video
Features full-time autofocus and sound; record cinematic-quality movies in Full 1080p HD format (1920 x 1080 pixels). 

Easy-To-Use
The D3100 features Nikon's Guide Mode with intuitive controls and on-board assistance helping you take better pictures every step of the way. 

Compact and Lightweight Design
Beautifully styled--ready to go wherever life takes you. 

Split-second Shutter Response
Eliminates the frustration of shutter delay, capturing moments that other cameras miss. 

Fast 11-point Autofocus System
Delivers razor-sharp pictures. 

ISO sensitivity 100-3200, expandable to ISO 12800 equivalent
Delivers exceptional results, even in the most challenging low-light situations. 

3-inch monitor
Features One-Touch Live View shooting and movie capture. 

Scene Auto Selector
Lets the D3100 decide the best mode to match the shooting situation when using Live View. 

EXPEED 2
Nikon's new image processing engine assures breathtakingly rich image quality, managing color, contrast, exposure, noise and speed. 

Scene Recognition System in Live View
Automatically optimizes exposure, autofocus, and white balance, allowing you to obtain beautiful photos without the hassle of making complicated camera adjustments yourself. 

6 Automatic Exposure Scene Modes
Just set the Mode dial to Portrait, Landscape, Child, Sports, Close-up or Night Portrait for stunning results in otherwise challenging conditions. 

Active D-Lighting
Restores picture-enhancing detail in shadows and highlights. 

D-Lighting in action. 
Picture Control
Choose from Standard, Neutral, Vivid, Monochrome, Portrait, or Landscape to apply a personal look and feel to your pictures. 

Automatic Image Sensor Cleaning
Ultrasonic process and exclusive Airflow Control combats the accumulation of dust in front of the image sensor, safeguarding image quality shot after shot. 

Built-in pop-up flash
Perfect for those times when there isn't enough light. 

In-camera Image Editing
Allows creative freedom, without the need for a computer, offering easy editing functions. 

Compatible Lenses  * AF-S and AF-I: All functions supported 
 * Type G or D AF NIKKOR without built-in autofocus motor: All functions except autofocus supported. IX NIKKOR lenses not supported. 
 * Other AF NIKKOR: All functions supported except autofocus and 3D color matrix metering II. Lenses for F3AF not supported. 
 * Type D PC NIKKOR: All functions supported except autofocus and some shooting modes. 
 * AI-P NIKKOR: All functions supported except autofocus and 3D color matrix metering II. 
 * Non-CPU: Autofocus not supported. Can be used in exposure mode M, but exposure meter does not function. 

Note: Electronic rangefinder can be used if lens has a maximum aperture of f/5.6 or faster. 

What's in the Box
D3100 digital SLR camera body; AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G VR Lens; EN-EL14 Rechargeable Li-ion Battery, MH-24 Battery Charger, DK-5 Eyepiece Cap, DK-20 Rubber Eyecap, AN-DC3 Camera Strap, BS-1 Accessory Shoe Cover, BF-1B Body Cap, ViewNX 2 CD-ROM
feature_bullets: 1080p HD video with full time AF

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,273 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
